alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 21 at 3:53AM EST until February 22 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Western and central Mohawk Valley, southern Adirondacks, Lake George Area, and southern Vermont. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The combination of some snowmelt and 0.75 to 1.75 inches of rain Tuesday into Tuesday night will lead to rises on rivers and streams. Some localized flooding is possible, especially in the vicinity of existing ice jams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer
